message.text: So there you are, the Golden Finger Hero! Our world was attacked by evil monsters, please save us! TUTORIAL: Hold Z to move to the next the dialog or open the achievement window. Press Z to attack.
"A strange energy wave is coming out of my finger! What the fuck is going on?!"

What are you waiting for? Is this the first time you've ever played a tutorial? As the most talented developer of this world, I have invented the simplest and most elegant gameplay - using only one key!
"I got this game for it's 18+ rating, but this developer is starting to creep me out..."

As you're incredibly dense, let me tell you how to play, again. This game only needs your Z key, so even Stephen Hawking can play it! Simple enough, right? It's better than other tutorials that take you 10 years to finish!
"What the hell was that opening music... seems like the only point of this game is this hot girl..."
You may be thinking, "how the fuck am I supposed finish this game?!"
Of course, isn't this the way that most mobile game companies makee their games these days?
Simply kill 999999 enemies and reach level 100 to finish this game.
So you want to give up? Good, shut down your device, take a walk outside, take a deep breath...
OR JUST PAY US TO WIN THIS GAME! TODAY'S SPECIAL DEAL: $99.99
But, if you still want to continue, we can talk later. I'll be right back.
When I first played these "epic" titles, I thought game developers were the gods of their worlds.
After many years, I found myself wrong. The gods of these games are not our developers, but YOU! THE PLAYER!
You complained that you don't have that much time to learn how to play, so we tried our best to make them as simply as we could.
Then you said the controls were too complex! So we developed this gameplay with only one key. Now we can't even find a place to put a button for in-app purchases!
You've heard of Pavlov's dog, right? If our game doesn't make players think, then what's the difference between dogs and players?
SO NOW I KNOW THAT'S WHAT YOU WANT. PAY TO WIN. AREN'T YOU GRATEFUL?
So, since you have played my awful game for this long already, I've decided to offer a little bit of help...
GameController.Instance.Level = 100;
Try using the QWER keys during your next playthrough (if there will be any).
Select:3
ALL DONE!
